description:
Many products are developed based on a hunch, a judgement call, and incomplete
information. Needless to say, most of them fail miserably. Startup founders
and business owners then ask themselves why. This course takes a different,
risk-mitigating, more scientific approach to the art of starting a business.
You’ll learn how to develop a product people really need by uncovering these
needs well in advance. Before you write one line of code, before you hire a
large team, before you take a big risk. You’ll learn the ins and outs of
learning if people need your product by implementing three activities to learn
from your future customers - Experience Sampling, Field Observation, and
Interviewing. After making sense of it all, you’ll be able to kick-start your
business with confidence in your knowledge and wisdom.
title: Researching User Needs
